dish_description: The dish is a simple preparation of large shrimp cooked with their shells on, seasoned with Tabasco, garlic, smoked paprika, and salt, then seared in a hot pan and served with a garnish of herbs.

cooking_steps.description: Prepare large shrimp by deveining them, but keep the shells on for cooking.
Add about a tablespoon of olive oil to a bowl or container for marinating the shrimp.
Season the shrimp with a good quarter teaspoon of Tabasco sauce.
Add about a quarter teaspoon of minced dry garlic to the shrimp.
Sprinkle a dash of smoked paprika over the shrimp for added flavor.
Optionally, let the seasoned shrimp marinate for a while to enhance the flavors. If marinating, do not add salt at this stage.
Just before cooking, season the shrimp with a little bit of salt if they were not marinated with salt.
Heat a pan until very hot, testing it with a few drops of water to ensure it's ready when the water beads on the surface.
Place the shrimp in the hot pan and let them char slightly, cooking for about a minute and a quarter to a minute and a half on each side.
Once the shrimp are seared and sealed, remove them from the pan.
Optionally, drizzle a dash of olive oil over the cooked shrimp for extra flavor.
Garnish the shrimp with herbs for color and presentation.
Serve the seared shrimp with the shell on and enjoy with your fingers.
